text: Thoridae is a family of cleaner shrimp, also known as broken-back shrimp or anemone shrimp. ==Genera== There are 36 recognised genera in the family: *Eualus Thallwitz, 1892 *Eumanningia Crosnier, 2000 *Exhippolysmata Stebbing, 1915 *Gelastocaris Kemp, 1914 *Gelastreutes Bruce, 1990 *Heptacarpus Holmes, 1900 *Latreutes Stimpson, 1860 *Lebbeus White, 1847 *Leontocaris Stebbing, 1905 *Lysmatella Borradaile, 1915 *Merhippolyte Bate, 1888 *Mimocaris Nobili, 1903 *Nauticaris Bate, 1888 *Paralatreutes Kemp, 1925 *Paralebbeus Bruce & Chace, 1986 *Phycocaris Kemp, 1916 *Saron Thallwitz, 1891 *Spirontocaris Bate, 1888 *Thinora Bruce, 1998 *Thor Kingsley, 1878 *Thorella Bruce, 1982 *Tozeuma Stimpson, 1860 *Trachycaris Calman, 1906 Morphological and genetic studies show that Thoridae is distinct from Hippolytidae.Christoffersen, M.L., 1987. Phylogenetic relationships of hippolytid genera, with an assignment of new families for the Crangonoidea and Alpheoidea (Crustacea, Decapoda, Caridea). Cladistics 3: 348-362.De Grave, S, Li, C.P., Tsang L.M., Chu K.H., Chan T.-Y. (2014). Unweaving hippolytoid systematics (Crustacea, Decapoda, Hippolytidae): resurrection of several families. Zoologica Scripta, 43, 496–507. ==References== Category:Alpheoidea
title: Thoridae
